question.text:
Number of complexes from the following with even number of unpaired " \(\mathrm{d}\) " electrons is \(\qquad\) \(\left[\mathrm{V}\left(\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}\right)_6\right]^{3+},\left[\mathrm{Cr}\left(\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}\right)_6\right]^{2+},\left[\mathrm{Fe}\left(\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}\right)_6\right]^{3+},\left[\mathrm{Ni}\left(\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}\right)_6\right]^{3+},\left[\mathrm{Cu}\left(\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}\right)_6\right]^{2+}\)
[Given atomic numbers : \(\mathrm{V}=23, \mathrm{Cr}=24, \mathrm{Fe}=26, \mathrm{Ni}=28 \mathrm{Cu}=29\)]

solution.text:
$\begin{aligned} & {\left[\mathrm{V}\left(\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}\right)_6\right]^{3+} \rightarrow \mathrm{d}^2 \mathrm{sp}^3} \\ & { }_{23} \mathrm{~V}:-[\mathrm{Ar}] 3 \mathrm{~d}^3 4 \mathrm{~s}^2 \\ & \left.\mathrm{~V}^{+3}:-[\mathrm{Ar}] 3 \mathrm{~d}^2, \mathrm{n}=2 \text { (even number of unpaired } \mathrm{e}^{-}\right) \\ & {\left[\mathrm{Cr}\left(\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}\right)_6\right]^{2+} \rightarrow \mathrm{sp}^3 \mathrm{~d}^2} \\ & { }_{24} \mathrm{Cr}:-[\mathrm{Ar}] 3 \mathrm{~d}^5 4 \mathrm{~s}^1 \\ & \left.\mathrm{Cr}^{+2}:-[\mathrm{Ar}] 3 \mathrm{~d}^4, \mathrm{n}=4 \text { (even number of unpaired } \mathrm{e}^{-}\right)\end{aligned}$
$\begin{aligned} & {\left[\mathrm{Fe}\left(\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}\right)_6\right]^{3+} \rightarrow \mathrm{sp}^3 \mathrm{~d}^2} \\ & \mathrm{Fe}^{3+}:-[\mathrm{Ar}] 3 \mathrm{~d}^5 4 \mathrm{~s}^0 \\ & \mathrm{n}=5\left(\text { odd number of unpaired } \mathrm{e}^{-}\right) \\ & {\left[\mathrm{Ni}\left(\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}\right)_6\right]^{3+} \rightarrow \mathrm{sp}^3 \mathrm{~d}^2} \\ & \mathrm{Ni}:-[\mathrm{Ar}] 3 \mathrm{~d}^8 4 \mathrm{~s}^2 \\ & \left.\mathrm{Ni}^{+3}:-[\mathrm{Ar}] 3 \mathrm{~d}^7, \mathrm{n}=3 \text { (odd number of unpaired } \mathrm{e}^{-}\right) \\ & {\left[\mathrm{Cu}\left(\mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}\right)_6\right]^{2+} \rightarrow \mathrm{sp}^3 \mathrm{~d}^2} \\ & \mathrm{Cu}:-[\mathrm{Ar}] 3 \mathrm{~d}^9 4 \mathrm{~s}^0 \\ & \left.\mathrm{n}=1 \text { (odd number of unpaired } \mathrm{e}^{-}\right)\end{aligned}$

data.bucket: Must Do Ques (JEE Main) - Any Difficulty
